alert.note: Alert for Sebastian (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 14 at 6:25AM CDT until July 14 at 7:55AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in Arkansas, Crawford, Franklin and Sebastian. In Oklahoma, Adair, Cherokee, Le Flore and Sequoyah. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 625 AM CDT, Doppler radar continue to indicate scattered showers and thunderstorms across portions of east-central Oklahoma and west-central Arkansas. Flooding is likely ongoing from the previous heavy rainfall of 2 and 5 inches that fell earlier this morning. An additional inch may be possible in few locations. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Sallisaw... Stilwell... Charleston... Cedarville... Natural Dam... Greenwood... Alma... Barling... Pocola... Muldrow... Roland... Lavaca... Spiro... Arkoma... Mulberry... Dyer... Hackett... Hartford... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
